TI: Responses of acetylcholine release and regional blood flow in the hippocampus during walking in aged rats.
AB: Walking produced increases in both the extracellular acetylcholine level and regional blood flow in the hippocampus in aged rats 26-29 months old. The present results in aged rats were compared with our previous data in young adult rats (Nakajima et al., 2003), and it was found that both the acetylcholine and blood flow responses in the hippocampus were well maintained in aged rats.
AD: Department of the Autonomic Nervous System, Tokyo Metropolitan Institute of Gerontology, 35-2 Sakae-cho, Itabashi-ku, Tokyo 173-0015, Japan. suchida@tmig.or.jp
JT: The journal of physiological sciences : JPS
SO: J Physiol Sci. 2006 Jun;56(3):253-7. doi: 10.2170/physiolsci.SC001706. Epub 2006 Jun 8.
